intro: Hieracium amaureilema, commonly known as the golden hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium amaureilema is often found in open meadows and is adapted to the harsh climatic conditions of its high-altitude environment.
